description: Dive into "Majestic Castles of Jaipur: A Royal Journey" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Majestic Castles of Jaipur: A Royal Journey

places.generalDescription: Embarking on a journey from Zostel, the vibrant hostel in Jaipur, leads you to the magnificent Amber Fort. This stunning fort, perched atop a hill, offers breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape. As you explore its intricate architecture and rich history, you'll be captivated by its beauty. After soaking in all that Amber Fort has to offer, return to your cozy base at Zostel for a well-deserved rest. It's an adventure filled with culture and scenic splendor!

sources.snippet: The Amber Palace, set upon a sprawling hillside, is about a half-hour away from the Hawa Mahal. Built by Maharaja Man Singh during the 16th century, it was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2013. The vast palace is constructed with pale yellow and pink sandstone and white marble.
sources.shortName: 6 Royal Palaces to Visit in Jaipur With Family

places.name: Amber Palace

reviews.text: Amer Fort is a real gem in Jaipur, a blend of rich history, majestic architecture, and breathtaking views. Each corner of the fort feels like a step back in time, with its grand courtyards, intricate mirror work, beautiful gates, and strong fortified walls. The views from the top are simply amazing, overlooking the city and the surrounding hills. We really enjoyed exploring its stories, taking photos, and soaking in the royal atmosphere. Definitely a must-visit if you're in Jaipur!

Quite a good experience.
There are so many places to see inside the fort.
It's recommended to visit the fort from chand pol gate if accompanied by elder people.
The fort is well built and in a very good condition.
Guide is recommended as it's a huge fort with lots of historical facts.
P.s: don't buy anything from RTDC shops , as the charge 3times more prices than local market in jaipur)

Amazing construction on top of the hill with incredible views of the mountains, the wall. The history is quite interesting as well, and having a guide will help you to better understand the rich cultural importance of the palace for the region and to India. Suggest arrive early to have a better experience.

places.generalDescription: Amber Palace, also known as Amer Fort, is a stunning architectural marvel located in Jaipur, Rajasthan. This magnificent fort showcases a blend of Hindu and Muslim design elements, making it a unique cultural landmark. Visitors can enjoy elephant rides that add to the enchanting experience of exploring this historical site. The fort's intricate structures are built from various colored stones‚Äîmilk white, light yellow, rose red, and pure white‚Äîwhich give it an amber-like appearance from afar.

sources.snippet: Amber (pronounced Amer) is at a distance of about 11 kilometres from Jaipur. Now a UNESCO World Heritage Site, it was the bastion of the Kachwahas of Amber, until the capital was moved to the plains, to what is today Jaipur. The palace, located in craggy hills, is a beautiful melange of Hindu and Mughal styles.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit, Sightseeing, Trip to Jaipur- Rajasthan Tourism

places.name: Amber Palace

reviews.text:
Amber Fort is one of those places that leaves you awestruck the moment you see it........Huge, majestic, and full of history, it easily takes 2‚Äì3 hours to explore........though you'll hardly notice the time passing. The Sheesh Mahal is simply magical........the tiny mirrors sparkle beautifully, even in the faintest light.
I'd highly recommend taking a local guide........they share fascinating stories, little-known facts, and bring the fort's past to life in a way that signboards never can. The architecture is stunning........with a perfect blend of Rajput charm and Mughal elegance, and the views of Maota Lake from the top are picture-perfect.
If you can........arrive early to enjoy the elephant ride up to the fort........it's a unique, royal touch to the experience. For a different vibe........there's also a light and sound show in the evening that tells the fort's history beautifully.
Amber Fort isn't just a sightseeing spot........it's a walk through Rajasthan's glorious past........and honestly........it's one of Jaipur's must-visits.

Amber Fort is a beautiful place to visit in Jaipur. The architecture is amazing and the views from the top are stunning. The fort is quite big, so it's worth taking some time to explore. It can get busy, but overall it's a great experience and a highlight of Jaipur.

And I also strongly suggest to hire a guide to dive even deeper into the history of Amber Palace / Fort.

Very very excited to visit here... Great place... And it is biggest fort I have ever seen. Must go... Jaipur is very beautiful city lots of historic Places are there. But make sure u have at least 5 hours to visit this fort... And inside the fort thare is nothing to eat so make sure your tummy is full before go inside.

places.generalDescription: Nahargarh Fort, built in 1734 above Jaipur, is part of a trio of forts along with Jaigarh and Amer. It was constructed to protect the city and has a rich military history. The fort also houses a wax museum featuring sports stars, freedom fighters, and Bollywood celebrities. Visitors can embark on a cycling expedition to explore the fort in a unique way while enjoying stunning views of Jaipur and Man Sagar Lake.

sources.snippet: Built-in 1734 by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II and extended over the years; Nahargarh Fort in Jaipur is of great historical significance. This fort featured in the treaties drawn up between the Rajput and Maratha forces in the 18th century as a means of preventing war and conflict. Nahargarh Fort provides an enchanting view of Jaipur city which is one of the reasons it was a retreat residence when in use.
sources.shortName: A UNESCO World Heritage Site

sources.snippet: When the troubled spirit of Prince Nahar Singh kept interfering in the construction of this fort, it was placated by building a shrine for his soul to rest and by naming the structure Nahargarh, to honor him. Soon enough, the construction troubles stopped and the fort was built. This was in 1734 and the fort was being built by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh as a retreat for himself and his family.
sources.shortName: 11 Top Historical Places in Jaipur with Timings & Entry Fee

sources.snippet: Nahargarh Fort sits proudly on a ridge of the Aravalli Hills, creating an impressive northern backdrop to the city of Jaipur. It was constructed during the reign of Jai Singh in 1734, and was later expanded in 1868. Nahargarh, which means abode of tigers, was a formidable barrier, defending Jaipur against attacking enemies.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit, Sightseeing, Trip to Jaipur- Rajasthan Tourism

sources.snippet: Perched atop a ridge in the Aravalli Hills, Nahargarh Fort serves as a striking northern backdrop to the Jaipur city. Nahargarh, which means the abode of tigers, provided a formidable defence against the enemies in the olden days. Today, the palace remains a popular spot for local picnics and a major tourist attraction.
sources.shortName: Historical Places Near Jaipur : Most Famous Historical Places in Jaipur

sources.snippet: The Nahargarh Fort offers a beautiful view of the pink city below. Its strategic location and massive ramparts made it a formidable defensive fortress. Nahargarh Fort is like a cool guardian, always looking over the cityscape, perched on top,giving you the best seat in the house overlooking the pink city below.
sources.shortName: 8 Majestic Forts In Jaipur, An Ode to Timeless Grandeur

sources.snippet: Overlooking the city of Jaipur, this fort, built by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II, stands tall and impressive. The corridors of this fort have some delicate frescoes and arches (good phot-ops). The roof of the fort looks spectacular with its domes and spires.
sources.shortName: Must-Visit Places In Jaipur For First Time Travellers

places.name: Nahargarh Fort

reviews.text: Nahargarh Fort is one of the best places to visit in Jaipur especially if you enjoy nature and views. The fort is easily reachable by bike with a smooth road and a short ride through scenic hills. The views from the top are just stunning especially during sunset when you can see the whole city of Jaipur. The fort itself has beautiful old architecture and a peaceful vibe. There are a few cafes inside to relax and enjoy snacks. The area is clean and well maintained

A must visit place in Jaipur. You can drive your car up to the top of the hill to reach this fort. Road in good but in the end very narrow. Parking is available near fort. From roof top of this fort, you get best view of entire Jaipur city. Amazing place.

Visited Nahargarh Fort recently and had a great time. The entry ticket is very reasonably priced at just ‚Çπ52 per person. The fort is open from 9:00 AM to 9:30 PM, giving you plenty of time to explore at your own pace.

We booked our own bike to get there - cost about ‚Çπ50 for parking, which is also fair considering the location and security.

The views from the top are absolutely stunning, especially during sunset. The fort itself is well-maintained and offers a mix of history, architecture, and panoramic city views. Definitely worth a visit if you're in Jaipur!

Would recommend bringing water and wearing comfortable shoes, especially if you plan to walk around a lot. Overall, a memorable and budget-friendly experience. üëç

places.address: Krishna Nagar, Brahampuri, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302001, India

places.generalDescription: Perched atop a hill, Moti Doongri Fort is a majestic royal residence that draws inspiration from Scottish castles. It offers stunning views of the renowned Ganesh temple below. Once the official abode of Maharani Gayatri Devi, celebrated as one of the world's most beautiful women, this small yet striking fort boasts a backdrop featuring the Birla Temple.

sources.snippet: The mighty Dungri Fort resembles the Scottish castle, nestled on the pinnacle of the hill that dominates the iconic city of Jaipur. This fortress is no longer open to the public however the scenic vicinity makes it pretty famous with photography enthusiasts gaining it‚Äôs position on the list of forts in jaipur. An exciting fact about this castle is that it is devoted to Lord Ganesha and the pearl roof of the Dungri Fort is not just a place of worship, it is also a symbol of non secular devotion as devotees trust that visiting the temple brings benefits and prosperity.
sources.shortName: 8 Majestic Forts In Jaipur, An Ode to Timeless Grandeur

sources.snippet: Perched upon a hillock, Moti Doongri is a small palace that resembles an old Scottish castle in Rajasthan. It still belongs to the royal family; hence visitors are not allowed inside the palace. However, there is a beautiful temple at the foothills of the fort dedicated to Lord Ganesha that is open for one and all.
sources.shortName: Historical Places Near Jaipur : Most Famous Historical Places in Jaipur

places.name: Moti Doongri Fort

reviews.text: One of the best picturesque locations in the city. It's a private residence perched on a small hillock. The view from Rambagh hotel is lovely.
What a magical view during the rains, magnificent fort, opens once a year on Mahashivratri.

Its a private property of Jaipur Royale family and no one can visit this temple or fort except one day and that is Maha Shivratri. It looks so beautiful and one of the historical landmarks of Jaipur. I took this picture from JDA rooftopüòâ

places.address: VRV8+8PR, near Birla Mandir, Jaipur, Tilak Nagar, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302004, India

places.generalDescription: Amer Fort, located in Jaipur, Rajasthan, is complemented by the nearby Jaigarh Fort. Offering breathtaking panoramic views of Amer Fort and its surroundings, Jaigarh Fort provides visitors with stunning vistas of the fort complex, Maota Lake, and the rugged Aravalli hills. This historical site boasts remarkable architecture and holds significant historical value. Visitors can expect to spend around 3-4 hours exploring this well-maintained and historically rich location.

sources.snippet: No other structure takes you back to Jaipur‚Äôs majestic past as impeccably as the sprawling, arresting Amer Fort. Constructed on the ruins of an old Amer settlement of the Meena kings, Amer Fort (alternatively ‚ÄòAmber‚Äô) is mired in history, stories of kings and queens, and astonishing architectural mastery. Made largely out of sandstone and marble, the fort consists of a series of courtyards constructed at different levels, stunning palaces like the illuminated Sheesh Mahal, historical temples like the Shila Devi shrine, halls adorned with frescoes, painted ceilings and marble inlay work, and ornamental gardens laid out in the Islamic charbagh style.
sources.shortName: 11 Top Historical Places in Jaipur with Timings & Entry Fee

places.name: Amber fort downhill area

reviews.text: Buying composite ticket will be cheaper. Great experience visiting here. If having no illness then better to climb by walk to the fort instead of going by jeep. Beautiful scenery is visible.

Amer Fort is a majestic and sprawling fort with stunning architecture and historical significance. I took a guide, which was very helpful in navigating the fort and ensuring I didn't miss any key spots. Without a guide, it's easy to overlook some of the interesting areas and details. The fort is impressive, with beautiful courtyards and panoramic views, making it a must-visit with the added benefit of guided insight.
Worth the uphill walk to the fort. The entrance fee is 150 rupees, cash only. The views from the top of the fort are spectacular

places.address: XVQ3+54F, Amer Rd - Downhill, Devisinghpura, Amer, Rajasthan 302028, India

places.generalDescription: Hawa Mahal, often referred to as the "Palace of Winds," is a stunning architectural gem located in Jaipur, Rajasthan. Built in 1799 by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh, this five-story palace is renowned for its striking facade adorned with numerous small windows known as jharokhas. These intricately designed openings not only enhance the beauty of the structure but also serve a practical purpose by allowing cool breezes to flow through, making it an early form of natural air conditioning.

sources.snippet: One of the most important landmarks in the city of Jaipur, the renowned Hawa Mahal or the Palace of Winds was constructed in 1799 by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh as a continuation to the stunning City Palace, among the must-include places in Jaipur 4 day tour. The main architect of this palace is Lal Chand Ustad and the palace is believed to have been constructed in the form of the crown of Krishna, the Hindu God. The palace is constructed of beautiful red and pink sandstone and it looks like a five-storeyed Pyramid.
sources.shortName: 5 Luxurious Palaces of Jaipur that You Must Visit Once

sources.snippet: This 18 th-century structure, situated on Badi Chaupad, is the most iconic image of Jaipur that every Indian and someone from outside the country has of the city. Constructed by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh in 1799, the building is actually a fa√ßade, built on the edge of the City Palace. Connected to the Zenana or the ladies‚Äô quarters, this 5-storeyed latticed structure was meant to enable the royal ladies to view the daily life of the city, the parades and the royal processions while still staying in purdah.
sources.shortName: 11 Top Historical Places in Jaipur with Timings & Entry Fee

sources.snippet: Hawa Mahal, literally the Palace of Winds, was built in 1799 by the poet king Sawai Pratap Singh as a summer retreat for him and his family. It also served as a place where the ladies of the royal household could observe everyday life without being seen themselves. This unique five-storey structure is a blend of Hindu and Islamic architecture, and the exterior, with its small latticed windows (called jharokhas), resembles the crown of Lord Krishna.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit, Sightseeing, Trip to Jaipur- Rajasthan Tourism

sources.snippet: An iconic landmark of the city, the honeycomb-shaped palace features beautiful jharokhas and windows. This five-storey building has been built without a foundation and is known for its exceptional ventilation, which is also the reason behind its name, Hawa Mahal, which literally translates to ‚ÄòPalace of the Winds‚Äô. The palace was mainly constructed to enable the ladies of the royal family to see the busy streets from the palace jharokhas.
sources.shortName: Historical Places Near Jaipur : Most Famous Historical Places in Jaipur

sources.snippet: Hawa Mahal and Jal Mahal are two that are incredibly famous all over the world for their beauty and architecture. Others like Rajmahal Palace and Rambagh Palace are known for being 2 of the best royal heritage hotels in India. The 7 royal palaces in Jaipur mentioned in this article are some of the most beautiful examples of Indo-Mughal architecture and reflect the rich history of the Kachwaha kings of Rajasthan.
sources.shortName: 7 Magnificent Royal Palaces in Jaipur That You Must Visit

sources.snippet: One of the most important landmarks in the city, the Hawa Mahal or the ‚ÄòPalace of Winds‚Äô was built in 1799 by Maharaj Sawai Pratap Singh. The beautiful honeycomb-like structure has 950-odd windows (‚Äòjharokas‚Äô), replete with balconies. Adding to the mystique is the red-and-pink sandstone that gives the structure its unique colour.
sources.shortName: 6 Royal Palaces to Visit in Jaipur With Family

sources.snippet: Hawa Mahal is a monument like no other; in India or the world. Completed in 1799 and constructed with pink and red sandstone; the exteriors of this palace stand out for the fact that it closely resembles the honeycomb of a beehive with 953 ‚ÄúJharokhas‚Äù or small windows that are brilliantly accentuated with exquisite latticework.
sources.shortName: A UNESCO World Heritage Site

sources.snippet: You can always start with a visit to Hawa Mahal or Palace of Winds. The palace is located in Badi Choupad and looks like a honeycomb from afar. Built by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh, this fine specimen of Rajput architecture has an astounding number of small windows, also called jharokhas‚Äî953 in total.
sources.shortName: Must-Visit Places In Jaipur For First Time Travellers

sources.snippet: Hawa Mahal is a palace built of red and pink sandstone, that translates to ‚ÄúPalace of Winds‚Äù. Hawa Mahal, built in 1799, is Jaipur‚Äôs most distinct and renowned landmark that rises five storeys. The top of the palace offers astounding views of the City Palace and Jantar Mantar.
sources.shortName: The Best of Both Worlds - Delhi and Jaipur | Neemrana Fort-Palace

sources.snippet: The Hawa Mahal was built in the year 1798 by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh. The palace is a five-storey construction meant for the ladies of the royal families to observe the way of the commoners. The key highlight is the meticulous latticework on the palace windows.
sources.shortName: 10 Famous Palaces in Jaipur, Jaipur Palace, Palaces in Jaipur

places.name: Hawa Mahal

reviews.text: The experience of being inside the palace was equally enriching. Navigating the winding ramps and staircases, I was able to appreciate the intricate details of the architecture up close. The views of the city from the upper floors are breathtaking, offering a panoramic perspective of Jaipur's vibrant streets and surrounding hills. It's a place that perfectly blends historical significance with stunning beauty. Whether you're a history buff, an architecture enthusiast, or simply looking for a glimpse into India's rich heritage, the Hawa Mahal is an absolute must-visit. It's an unforgettable experience that truly embodies the spirit of Jaipur.

If something in you remembers old stories, quiet dreams, or the simple joy of standing somewhere that has seen centuries pass-Hawa Mahal is made for you. It's not just a monument; it's a breath, a glimpse into royal lives, and a haven of artistry.
I'd recommend going early-beat the heat, catch the gentle light, and let yourself be still for a moment. Let the wind, the pink walls, and the stairs carry you a little away from today and into something tender and timeless.

A must-visit landmark in Jaipur! Hawa Mahal is an architectural gem with stunning fa√ßade and intricate lattice windows that truly live up to its name The Palace of Winds. The view from the top gives a beautiful glimpse of the old city.

However, the inside is not as grand as the exterior, and there's not much information displayed about its history - so it helps if you go with a guide or read up a bit beforehand.

Great for photography, especially during sunrise or sunset. Night view is also beautiful with the lights on.

places.address: Hawa Mahal Rd, Badi Choupad, J.D.A. Market, Pink City, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302002, India
